page.title: 02CHANGING USES OF BUILDINGS
page.content: This block is full of buildings which are now used for something different from their original purpose. {Mill House, Mill Lane, Hamsey}was a working water mill until 1879. It became unprofitable becuse larger steam mills were taking over. It was {converted into a house}and has been in the family of the present owners, the Clarkes, for centuries. {The Post Office, Offham}is now a{tea {room,}selling home-made scones. Since people here now have cars they can drive into Lewes and visit the post office whilst doing their weekly shopping.The post box is still used. {Malling House}was built in 1720 as a home for the Spence family. In 1947 it was bought by the County Council and is now{Sussex Police Headquarters. More buildings have been added and it is the largest employer in the block.
